replies.body:
Hello! Thank you for the update and reimbursement! Personally I'm content with this response except for one thing... Can the loss be removed from our records because we didn't 'play'? I noticed this wasn't mentioned!
I know some teams DID play, so what are the plans for that?

Hey Shadow Entrancer! Teams aren't carried forward between tournaments, meaning you create (or remake) a team each time. Because of this, win/loss is self-contained to each tournament, so with every new Clash tournament your new team's record will begin with a clean state at 0-0.

TL;DR: Record of your team's performance won't be stored, but it doesn't mean you can't keep tabs yourself for bragging rights ;)
Thank you very much for the clarification, didn't realise that! :)

ARURF is coming back in a patch that ain't so far away. Getting it to you over the weekend was purely to make sure you had something to help with the absence of Clash (that's why it was so buggy with a bunch of champs disabled and nilch champ select trading). Once it's functional, it'll return!
When will next clash, which is the first one after Beta Cup begin? Looking forward to it.

I think one of my biggest issues with Clash right now is how late it starts for us in New Zealand. Taking into thought Lock in and scouting phase. We're not even in champion select by 9:30. That means for most people either studying or working, we will get maybe one game in before it's even like 10:30 or closer to 11pm!
I get that you can't start class at 5pm in Australia but surely even 6pm AUS time would be more acceptable and would give people from NZ time to at least get more than maybe one game in
Remember that AUS has a wide span of timezones. 6pm AEST (Sydney time) is *4pm* in WA, so while that might be better for NZ, it's much less so for a significant chunk of people over there.

Yeah, I mean I do get what you mean. But it's still really feel's bad for us in NZ, because from what I remember reading about clash (And I could very well be wrong so don't hold me to it) is that you can join later..?
So it's like, wouldn't it be fairer to the entirety of the NZ playerbase to start a little earlier and still have AUS players join later. 
IDK just how I see it is that by making it so late for the New Zealand player base, it's super feels bad for most of the New Zealand League community

You can't join later. If you aren't there for lock in phase you don't play that night. If you lose, or don't make it for one night, you can play the next day, but you won't be able to reach the 16 team bracket (the "big leagues" of your tier) or get the biggest rewards.

It sucks, and depending on schedules it might mean that some people may never really be able to play clash, but you can't accommodate everyone, it's just not possible, so the best option they have is to accommodate as many people as possible. Since it's a recurring event, there's every chance that some people who normally can't play will eventually see those opportunities.

It should speak a lot that just as you are asking if it could be pushed back, there are people asking if it could be pushed forward.
